intro: Platostoma cambodgense var. subulatum, commonly known as the Cambodian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green cyathium inflorescences, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
